SEARCH
Package org.entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
org.entity.Entity
org.entity.Player
public class Player extends Entity
The Player class represents the player character in the game. It extends the base Entity class and includes methods for updating the player's position, handling user input, and drawing the character on the screen. Additionally, it contains methods for loading player character images and managing interactions with game objects.
Author:
Nicole Malku, Usman Aziz, Curtis Pu, Ryan Chong

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(GameScreen screen, KeyboardInput keyInput)
      Constructs a Player object associated with GameScreen and KeyboardInput instance. This constructor initializes the player's screen coordinates, collision area, and default values. It also sets up the player's starting position and loads the player character images.
      Parameters:
      screen - The GameScreen instance to associate with this Player.
      keyInput - The KeyboardInput instance to handle user input.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(int map)

    • setDefaultVals

      public void setDefaultVals()

    • setDefaultPositions

      public void setDefaultPositions()

    • restoreLife

      public void restoreLife()

    • getImage

      public void getImage()
      Loads images for different directions and animation frames of the player character.

      This method uses the ImageIO class to read images from the specified file paths for various directions (left, right, up, down) and animation frames (1, 2). The loaded images are assigned to the corresponding variables (l1, l2, r1, r2, f1, f2, b1, b2) for later use in drawing the player's character.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the position and state of the player object based on user input and collisions.

      This method checks the state of W,A,S,D keys (up, left, down, right) and updates the player's position accordingly. It then performs collision detection with the game world tiles and other objects. If a collision occurs with an object, it triggers the corresponding action, such as consumption or loss checking.

      The method also manages a side-switching mechanism for animation purposes when the player is in motion.

    • consumeObject

      public void consumeObject(int index)
      Consumes game objects based on collision index and updates the player's status accordingly.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the collided object in the game object array.

    • checkWin

      public void checkWin()
      Helper function to continually check if the player has won the game/level. Facilitiates transition between maps.

    • checkLoss

      public void checkLoss()
      Helper function to check if the player has lost the game

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D myGraphics)
      Draws the player character using the correct images based onthe current direction and animation frame.
      Parameters:
      myGraphics - The Graphics2D context on which to draw the player character.
